result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Clause was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Steven J Clause in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Steven J Clause in custody.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared via phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Sam Filippo presiding.  Court calls case.  Atty Schellgell cites appearances.  DA requests $5,000 signature bond with conditions of absolute sobriety and to return to current living situation and conversion to cash if violates.  Attorney Snyder argues conditions that it may not be defendant's choice to remain in current living situation.  No objection from DA if def provides paperwork regarding release. Court states if def accused of violating bond, would have hearing, no automatic conversion.   Other conditions of bond are in place.  Bond covers 16CF12 and 12CF13.  Future court date not set on record:  7/14/16 at 1:00 p.m.

This bond covers 16CF12 and 16CF13. Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances, no taverns, no liquor stores.  Defendant shall submit to random PBTS upon request of law enforcement.  If refuses or if result is above. 00, defendant shall be remanded to jail.  Defendant shall return to previous living arrangements at Sober House Living during pendency of case.  If released from or unable to remain at Sober House Living, shall provide court with paperwork proving same.

Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls all cases. Non-appearance of defendant.  Warrant authorized by court.  All cases track together.  klr
Adjourned initial appearance on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court.   Frederick J. Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All citations to track with criminal cases.  Atty Snyder concerned def did not recieve notice of hearing.  Requests continuance.  No objection from DA.  Court grants continuance.  Signature bond previously set covers 16CF13 and 16CF12.
Initial appearance on May 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances, no taverns, no liquor stores.  Defendant shall submit to random PBTS upon request of law enforcement.  If refuses or if result is above. 00, defendant shall be remanded to jail.  Defendant may be released if someone sober appears to pick him up at the Iron County Sheriff's Dept. and agrees to transport def to sister's home.  Sister is to contact the Iron County Sheriff's Dept. and confirm that he can reside with her.
